They shall lift up their voice/cry shrilly. The righteous who remain will lift up their voice—a phrase often associated with prayer (Gen. 21:16) and song (42:11). When the Lord comes, all "who remain, even from the least unto the greatest…shall be filled with the knowledge of the Lord, and shall see eye to eye, and shall lift up their voice, and with the voice together sing this new song" (D&C 84:98). The words to the song are found in D&C 84:99-102.

they shall cry aloud. This pertains to the preaching of the gospel. Joseph Smith counseled the elders of the Church: "Oh, ye elders of Israel, hearken to my voice; and when you are sent into the world to preach, tell those things you are sent to tell; preach and cry aloud, 'Repent ye, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand; repent and believe the Gospel.'"

they shall cry…from the sea. The Lord's servants cry across the sea to all other nations, inviting them to become part of the gospel.
